intro: Saurauia panayensis, commonly known as the Panay stonecress, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions and forest understories. It is notable for its unique morphology and is considered an endemic species, found only on the island of Panay. Due to habitat loss, it is also listed as critically endangered.
